Date and time formats.comment: Modified from ICU4J copy to add params (likewise with the other date/time tests); 1722746637000 is 2024-08-03 21:43:57 PDT

Chaining.comment: Horibly long, but I really wanted to test multiple declarations with overrides, and you can't join strings in JSON
Chaining.exp: Hello John, you want '9:43 PM', 'August 3, 2024 at 9:43 PM', or '8/3/24, 9:43:57 PM Pacific Daylight Time' or even 'Saturday, August 3, 2024 at 9:43 PM'?
Chaining.ignoreTest: ICU-22754 ICU4C doesn't implement this kind of function composition yet. See https://github.com/unicode-org/message-format-wg/issues/515

Number formatter.ignoreTest: ICU-22754 No default formatting for numbers, so it's formatted as a literal string. Is this in the spec?
ICU-22754 No default formatting for numbers, so it's formatted as a literal string. Is this in the spec?
